question.questionText: Pete put a marble in a cup of water as shown in the picture. What evidence indicates whether the marble is more or less dense than the water?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The marble is on the bottom of the cup (under the water).

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: My evidence is the picture. When an object is denser than water, it shrinks. The picture showed that the marble sinks, so the marble is denser than the water.
When something is more dense than water it will sink which is what the marble did.
Because it is a solid hard rock. But if it was ice it would not sink it would float.
The marble is denser so the denser it is the more it sinks.
